definition: to get back on the right path/to mend one's ways
to bewilder/crazy about/fan/enthusiast/lost/confused
way/route/road
to know/to be aware
to return (to)

sentences.english: The advantage of the emotions is that they lead us astray.
sentences.chinese: 感情的利益便是争我们迷途知返。

definition: lit. to rein in the horse at the edge of the precipice (idiom)/fig. to act in the nick of time
to repent
to mend one's ways (idiom)/to turn over a new leaf
lit. to wash one's heart and renew one's face (idiom); to repent sincerely and mend one's mistaken ways/to turn over a new leaf
completely correcting one's former misdeeds (idiom); to repent past mistakes and turn over a new leaf/a reformed character
to reform and start afresh (idiom); to turn over a new leaf
the return of a prodigal son (idiom)
a prodigal son returned home is worth more than gold
pinyin: lang4 zi3 hui2 tou2 jin1 bu4 huan4

definition: to see the error of one's ways/to make a clean break with one's past
to renounce evil and turn to virtue (idiom)
to take a wrong step in life (idiom)/to go astray
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to start a new life/to make a fresh start
to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
to regret/to repent
to renounce the dark and seek the light/to give up one's wrong way of life and turn to a better one
